examples: As they say, a clean conscience makes a soft pillow.
He didn’t want somebody’s death on his conscience.
Stealing that money from my parents has been eating away at my conscience for the past month.
Good luck getting that off your conscience.
I hope you have it on your conscience for the rest of your days!
words.defineEn: motivation deriving logically from ethical or moral principles that govern a person's thoughts and actions
words.defineVi: động lực xuất phát một cách hợp lý từ các nguyên tắc đạo đức hoặc đạo đức chi phối suy nghĩ và hành động của một người

examples: During World War Two in the US, some conscientious objectors volunteered for medical research as an alternative way to serve their country.
This is where you're not so conscientious about direction.
Or if you want to be more conscientious, you could practice that by volunteering to take on a project at work.

After watching Muhammad Ali sacrifice his heavyweight championship title, endure three years of being banned from boxing and face imprisonment, simply because he was a conscientious objector to the Vietnam War, I had to heed my conscience as well.
Even the most conscientious of credit users can have a car break down a week before pay day, or an unexpected trip to the vet for poor Mr. Fluffles.
words.defineEn: characterized by extreme care and great effort
words.defineVi: đặc trưng bởi sự chăm sóc cực độ và nỗ lực lớn

examples: Major life changes like this can fluster anyone, so just take everything one step at a time.
- You're flustered.
Steven Mnuchin said it way better than me, is like, you know, he’s flustered sometimes.
I'm just getting flustered because there's so much stuff you can do with it, and it's difficult for me to get across how cool that is.
I don't know, she was just kind of, she was kidding me, but it got me flustered, so, then when we get into the interview and she says, He's easily flustered.
words.defineEn: be flustered; behave in a confused manner
words.defineVi: bối rối; cư xử một cách bối rối

examples: Wait, wait, hold on everybody, I, people, I hope you realize, I hope you know, I'm more flustered.
words.defineEn: feeling confused, bothered, or overwhelmed, resulting in a loss of calmness or clear thinking
words.defineVi: cảm thấy bối rối, phiền phức hoặc choáng ngợp, dẫn đến mất bình tĩnh hoặc suy nghĩ rõ ràng

examples: He’s a very magnanimous person.
I mean we're hitting this point where it's not just about whether Donald Trump concedes and whether he's magnanimous.

If he were really even shrewd, he would be large-spirited and magnanimous right now, and do everything he could, and take credit, an earned credit for his administration, to produce a vaccine in eight months, nine months.
I mean, it would be in his interest to go out as a magnanimous and large historic figure, and serve his purposes, whatever they are in the future.

And while Americans saw themselves as magnanimous victors and we sent aid and we did this, Russians very much viewed themselves in the 1990s as this sort of humiliated former superpower and that it was embarrassing to be going through the indignities of serial economic crises, and having to accept American aid in and of itself was seen as humiliating in the 1990s, and not something that a great nation like Russia should be forced to accept.
words.defineEn: generous and understanding and tolerant
words.defineVi: hào phóng và hiểu biết và khoan dung

examples: And casino magnate and Republican mega-donor Sheldon Adelson has died after a long illness.
Tellingly, he used to run PR and advertisement for Mikhail Khodorkovsky, the oil magnate that Putin jails in 2003.
Bought by two sugar magnates in 1981, Lamborghini was resurrected.

Virgin Galactic has raised over a billion dollars in funding since its inception in 2004, though a lot of that money has come from British business magnate and founder Richard Branson and an Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund.
words.defineEn: a wealthy, influential, and successful businessperson
words.defineVi: một doanh nhân giàu có, có ảnh hưởng và thành công

examples: Well, magnets have two sides.
Now, magnets don’t attract all things.
Magnets also don’t attract plastic.
The magnet did!?
I mean, magnet.
words.defineEn: an object that makes iron come toward it because of the magnetic field that it produces
words.defineVi: một vật thể làm cho sắt tiến về phía nó vì từ trường mà nó tạo ra

examples: That’s because over time, Mars’s global magnetic field had magnetized rocks on its surface.
Well, they're both iron, but one of them is magnetized.
Now it's possible that I could have two pieces that are not magnetized.
Here on Earth, this happens all the time when rocks or metals become magnetized, but because those domains are in solid materials, they don’t interact in the same way.
In the demonstration, he magnetized needles and stuck each one in a cork floating on some water, with all the magnets’ south poles pointing up.
words.defineEn: make magnetic
words.defineVi: làm từ tính

examples: So, without a detailed written record on hand, they instead relied on myths to explain the magnificence of Great Zimbabwe.
words.defineEn: splendid or imposing in size or appearance
words.defineVi: lộng lẫy hoặc hùng vĩ về kích thước hoặc diện mạo

words.defineEn: lofty in style
words.defineVi: cao thượng trong phong cách

examples: The only question is the magnitude.
So my magnitudes are equal.
Then multiply the two magnitudes.
The opposite side of the angle is the magnitude of our Y component.
The magnitude of our horizontal component is four.
words.defineEn: the property of relative size or extent (whether large or small)
words.defineVi: tài sản có kích thước hoặc mức độ tương đối (dù lớn hay nhỏ)

words.defineEn: make senseless or dizzy by or as if by a blow
words.defineVi: làm mất cảm giác hoặc chóng mặt bởi hoặc như thể bởi một cú đánh

words.defineEn: so surprisingly impressive as to stun or overwhelm
words.defineVi: ấn tượng đến mức gây choáng hoặc choáng ngợp

examples: But the outcome essentially is that Boehner ends up having to publicly excoriate the very deal he negotiated with Obama, right, because if he didn’t, he would have been ousted as speaker.
words.defineEn: to harshly state that something is severely lacking or faulty
words.defineVi: để nói một cách khắc nghiệt rằng một cái gì đó đang thiếu nghiêm trọng hoặc bị lỗi

examples: Next is skin picking or excoriation disorder.
Hair pulling is called trichotillomania and skin picking is called excoriation disorder.
words.defineEn: severe censure
words.defineVi: kiểm duyệt nghiêm trọng

examples: Her irreverent chatter during the ceremony raised many people's eyebrows.
Based on Douglas Adams' irreverent sci-fi comedy book series of the same name, itself an adaptation of a radio show-- PETER JONES:
words.defineEn: showing lack of due respect or veneration
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự thiếu tôn trọng hoặc tôn kính

examples: Irreversible vasectomies, pulling out , and that slightly updated Bronze Age invention.
It viewed mental illness as an irreversible condition, almost like a personality trait, rather than a curable illness.
Alzheimer's disease is a form of progressive, irreversible dementia.
- If you do not reverse it within about four hours it can usually lead to irreversible scarring and permanent loss of erection.
Even though some of the damage is irreversible, not all hope is lost for the world's coral reefs.
words.defineEn: impossible to return to previous state
words.defineVi: không thể trở lại trạng thái trước đó

examples: But there are some things that are irrevocable and so dramatic and distressing that you can't brush them away.
words.defineEn: incapable of being retracted or revoked
words.defineVi: không có khả năng được rút lại hoặc thu hồi

words.defineEn: render helpless or defenseless
words.defineVi: làm cho bất lực hoặc tự vệ

words.defineEn: the act of assuming a prostrate position
words.defineVi: hành động giả định một vị trí phủ phục
